SENT.plain: We have previously shown that the gap junction protein γ 1 (GJC1) gene, encoding the connexin-45 protein, is inactivated by promoter hypermethylation in colorectal cancer
This was confirmed in a recent Endocrine-Related Cancer publication analyzing a limited number of samples
The aim of this study was to analyze GJC1 in a larger clinical cohort (n=485) and to assess whether or not the promoter hypermethylation was associated with clinical or pathological features
The methylation of GJC1 was confirmed to be tumor specific and was observed in 33% of colorectal cancers and 12% of adenomas
The methylation was strongly associated with BRAF mutations (P=5.64×10(-13)) as well as with proximal tumor location (P=1.42×10(-3)), features compatible with a CpG island methylator phenotype
